text_section1.text: It was supposed to be a big event -- for young Tad and his friends -- but it really turned out to be a farewell party --

text_section2.text: The Feast of the Rag Dolls

text_section3.text: And now, a toast to our honored guest! -- Well? Why do you all just sit there, staring -- as if you didn't hear a word I've been saying!

text_section1.text: Tad's world was his rag dolls... rag dolls of every description -- dolls upon which were lavished the love that only a boy of six could give...
Now this time we'll play train. I'll be the engineer and you, Mr. Raggedy Andy, will be the conductor...
But Tad's parents didn't share his enthusiasm for the dolls...

text_section2.text: No, Tad! No! I've told you a hundred times! I will not send away for any more of those dolls!

text_section3.text: But, gee, Dad... it's only a dollar ninety-eight... and you told me you didn't want me to pick up any more from junk heaps or second hand stores!

text_section1.text: Harry, we've simply got to make him get rid of those dirty things! They must be crawling with germs, and he leaves them all over the house!

text_section2.text: I know, but... he's very attached to them, Grace. We'd break his heart if we just threw them all out...

text_section1.text: Brrr! The way that thing looks at me... as if it understands what I'm saying! It's uncanny, Grace... I'm at my wits' end!

text_section2.text: Ben will be back from college for the weekend... maybe he can reason with Tad... the boy always looked up to his brother!

text_section1.text: Two days later Tad eagerly awaited his brother's arrival...

text_section2.text: Ben's coming home, fellas! He goes to college and I'll bet he's almost as smart as you!

text_section1.text: It was a day for celebration, for reverly... in Tad's imaginary world, strange tiny figures swayed in rhythmic movement and joy reigned triumphant...
Benny's coming home! Hurrah! Hurrah!
That evening, Ben's father explained their problem...

text_section2.text: ... And that's the story, Ben! Your mother and I are constantly tripping over those dolls - he leaves them all over the house!

text_section3.text: He talks to the dolls, Ben. And he says they talk to him!

text_section4.text: He's only a little boy, mother. I don't see any cause for you to be concerned...

text_section1.text: It's simply a matter of using psychology with him. Why, I just completed a course in basic child psychology... let me handle this!
The following morning...

text_section3.text: Just talking to my dolls Ben they're real smart they know everything!

text_section1.text: Talking? Rag dolls can't talk, Tad! Rag dolls are just toys!

text_section2.text: They can too talk -- they really can!

text_section1.text: Tell you what, kid... we'll have a party with the dolls... have a cake and everything ... then I'll try to talk to them... maybe ask them some questions...

text_section2.text: Oh, gee, Ben... would you? That'll be fun!

text_section1.text: But Tad... if I ask the dolls some questions and they don't answer that'll mean they really can't talk, won't it?

text_section2.text: Oh, they'll answer you, Ben... they always answer when I talk to them!

text_section1.text: So with mock solemnity, the big brother helped the little brother prop the limp rag dolls into sitting positions around a table...
And now I would like to ask any of you a question... `what is the sixth ancient wonder of the world?'
And after a long moment of silence...

text_section2.text: There! You see, Tad? None of them answered the question! They're just dolls, kid... stuffed with straw and rags! They can't really talk, can they... can they?

text_section3.text: N-No, Ben... I-I guess they can't r-really talk...

text_section1.text: Late the next evening...

text_section2.text: I'll just have time to catch the 12:07! So long, folks... I'm sorry about the dolls, Tad...

text_section3.text: It's okay, Ben... here's Raggedy Andy... I want to give him to you...

text_section1.text: The whistle of the incoming 12:07 greeted Ben as he arrived at the deserted station platform.

text_section2.text: Well, at least I straightened the kid out on that rag doll business...

text_section1.text: There's one less doll the folks will have to worry about!
The answer to your question is ... `the statue of Jupiter Olympus'! Goodbye, Ben!
No... it couldn't be... it couldn't... it couldn't...
